proof:
Proof. Let $P := \{v \in V : \text{deg}(v) \le b\}$. Then, $Q := V \setminus P$. This is clearly a partition, since each vertex is in exactly one of P or Q.

We will now prove the bound on $G[P]$. For every vertex $v \in P$, $\text{deg}(v) \le b$ in $G$. Since $G[P]$ is a subgraph of $G$, $\text{deg}(v) \le b$ in $G[P]$ as well. Hence, $\Delta(G[P]) \le b$.

Now for the bound on $|Q|$. It is known that the number of edges is equal to half the sum of the degrees. Since vertices in $Q$ have high degree and vertices in $P$ have low degree, the sum of degrees in $Q$ must be at least the sum of degrees in $P$. It follows that the total number of edges is bounded by the sum of degrees in $Q$. Hence, we have
$$ m \le \sum_{v \in V \setminus P} \text{deg}(v) > \sum_{v \in Q} b = |Q| \cdot b. $$
Then, we rearrange to get $|Q| < \frac{m}{b}$.
